item.title: Bio
item.description: Hi! My name is Ben and I’m currently doing a PhD in physics at Dirk Brockmann’s lab in Berlin. I’m located at the Robert Koch-Institut but am also affiliated with HU Berlin’s physics department and IRI Life Sciences. My research interest lies in identifying the underlying processes of human contact facilitating the spread of diseases. In particular I’m investigating the influence of structural properties of human contact networks or human transport networks, both of static and dynamic nature.
